title: How to Make a Fruit Trifle

steps.headline: Bring 2 2/3 cups (675ml) of milk to a boil in a saucepan.
Mix sugar and vanilla custard powder in the remaining 1/3 (75ml) cup of milk to make a smooth paste.
Pour the custard paste in boiling milk and cook for another 2-3 minutes with continuous stirring on medium heat.
Lay the loaf cake slices evenly in a 8" x 11" dish.
Pour half of the custard over the cake slices.
steps.description: Allow it to cool for 15 minutes at room temperature.

steps.headline: Open the can of fruits and drain out the fruit juice.
steps.description: Spread fruits in an even layer over the custard.

steps.headline: Pour the remaining half of the custard over the layer of fruits.
steps.description: Leave it aside after pouring in the rest of the custard.

steps.headline: Boil 2 cups (500ml) of water in a saucepan and pour the jelly crystals.
steps.description: Stir continuously until the jelly crystals are dissolved.

steps.headline: Pour the hot mixture into a mould or a flat dish.
steps.description: Allow it to cool for one hour at room temperature.

steps.headline: Cut the jelly in small cubes
Toss them evenly on top of the custard layer once the jelly mixture has cooled.
Refrigerate the dish until ready to serve.

text: Bring 2 2/3 cups (675ml) of milk to a boil in a saucepan.  Mix sugar and vanilla custard powder in the remaining 1/3 (75ml) cup of milk to make a smooth paste.  Pour the custard paste in boiling milk and cook for another 2-3 minutes with continuous stirring on medium heat.  Lay the loaf cake slices evenly in a 8" x 11" dish.  Pour half of the custard over the cake slices. Allow it to cool for 15 minutes at room temperature. Open the can of fruits and drain out the fruit juice. Spread fruits in an even layer over the custard. Pour the remaining half of the custard over the layer of fruits. Leave it aside after pouring in the rest of the custard. Boil 2 cups (500ml) of water in a saucepan and pour the jelly crystals. Stir continuously until the jelly crystals are dissolved. Pour the hot mixture into a mould or a flat dish. Allow it to cool for one hour at room temperature. Cut the jelly in small cubes  Toss them evenly on top of the custard layer once the jelly mixture has cooled.  Refrigerate the dish until ready to serve.  Finished.
